question_sentence: Which European nation voted to enshrine a woman's right to abortion as a "guaranteed freedom" in the constitution?
evidence: The bill to enshrine abortion rights in France's constitution was passed by the lower house of the country's parliament on Tuesday, by 493 to 30 votes. The controversial plan now goes to the upper-house Senate, where it faces resistance from the conservative Republicans and far-right National Rally.

question_sentence: Which top football manager said he couldn't do his job "on three wheels" as he announced his shock resignation?
evidence: In a shock announcement, the Liverpool manager said he would step down from the role at the end of the season because he no longer had the "energy" to continue. Find out more withThe Week Unwrappedpodcast.

question_sentence: Annual sales of which type of book have soared to £14.4 million as social media drives interest in the genre?
evidence: Sales last year hit the highest level since accurate official figures from BookScan began a decade ago. The surge in demand is being credited, in large part, to platforms such as Instagram and Facebook, which provide a space for unpublished authors to share their work and for readers to access poetry.

question_sentence: Which "Sesame Street" character received a flood of stressed-out responses this week after tweeting: "How is everybody doing?"
evidence: The "Sesame Street" favourite was hit by a flood of responses, many sharing grief and despair, after "checking in" with his online friends on X on Monday. Joining in fresh conversations about mental health triggered by his tweet, which has clocked up more than 200 million views, Elmo said he was "glad he asked", and posted the hashtag "#EmotionalWellBeing".

question_sentence: A former mobster avoided jail time this week after admitting stealing which iconic piece of film history?
choices: Holly Golightly's little black dress in "Breakfast at Tiffany's"
evidence: Dying former crook Terry Jon Martin, 76, who is in hospice care, was spared prison time by a Minnesota judge after he confessed to stealing the slippers from the Judy Garland Museum in the late actor’s home town of Grand Rapids.He said an old mob associate had persuaded him to commit the 2005 heist for "one last score".

question_sentence: Climate activists threw soup at which artwork in Paris's Louvre museum?
evidence: Two activists from "Riposte Alimentaire" (Food Retaliation) hurled soup onto the bulletproof glass protecting Leonardo da Vinci's painting on Sunday. "What's the most important thing?" the women shouted. "Art, or right to healthy and sustainable food?"

question_sentence: A man hoping to break a marathon world record narrowly avoided being arrested after Hertfordshire police spotted him training with what on his back?
evidence: Daniel Fairbrother is aiming to break the record for the "fastest marathon carrying a household appliance (white goods)", but was pulled over by police in Stevenage who mistook him for a thief. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to The Week'sTall Talesnewsletter.

question_sentence: What is the name of a new downloadable tool being used by artists to stop AI stealing their artwork from the internet?
evidence: The free "poisoning tool", created by the University of Chicago, protects digital artwork from being used to train generative AI models without permission. Nightshade was downloaded more than 250,000 times in five days.

question_sentence: US right-wing conspiracy theorists accused with pop star of being a "Pentagon asset"?
evidence: Right-wing conspiracy theorists have speculated that Swift's relationship with football star Travis Kelce is a "deep state psyop" orchestrated by the NFL and the US Democrats to help Joe Biden win the upcoming presidential election.

question_sentence: The number of female drinkers of which beer has risen by 24% year-on-year?
evidence: Diageo, which owns Guinness, has reported a steep hike in the second half of 2023 in the number of women drinking the Irish stout in Britain. Guinness was the most popular beer across pubs, bars and restaurants last year, according to industry data.

question_sentence: The CEOs of several big tech companies were grilled by Congress this week about which issue?
evidence: The chief executives of Meta, TikTok, Snap, Discord and X, formerly known as Twitter, testified before Congress about the harms social media platforms pose to young people. (Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: The San Francisco 49ers will play the Kansas City Chiefs in Super Bowl LVIII. Where will the game take place?
evidence: The Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas will host Super Bowl LVIII on February 11. The average ticket price this week was roughly $9,800, making it the most expensive Super Bowl on record. (Image credit: Ethan Miller/Getty Images)

question_sentence: The Biden administration released new energy standards for which home appliances?
evidence: The Department of Energy reaffirmed this week that gas stoves will not be banned in the US anytime soon. This comes after a Biden administration official set off a firestorm a year ago when he suggested the Consumer Product Safety Commission could ban gas stoves because they have been linked to childhood asthma. (Image credit: Richard Mundl/CTK/AP)

question_sentence: The IRS is now accepting 2023 federal income tax returns. In which month is the deadline for most Americans to file their returns?
evidence: The filing deadline for most people is April 15. If you are owed a refund — like the majority of tax filers — the IRS typically issues them within 21 days of accepting your return. (Image credit: Daniel Acker/Bloomberg/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Which country is on track to become the first country in the world to include abortion rights in its constitution?
evidence: The French National Assembly passed a historic bill on Tuesday that moves the country one step closer to enshrining the right to abortion in its constitution. (Image credit: Emmanuel Dunand/AFP/Getty Images)

question_sentence: One of the most famous paintings in the world was recently targeted by protesters. Which piece of art was it?
choices: “The Starry Night” by Vincent van Gogh
“The Last Supper” by Leonardo da Vinci
evidence: Environmental protesters hurled soup at the“Mona Lisa,“ but the painting was not damaged as it is protected by a glass casing. (Image credit: Sarah Meyssonnier/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which US Cabinet official is facing impeachment proceedings in the House?
evidence: House Republicans voted to advance an effort to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas, claiming he has committed high crimes and misdemeanors for his handling of the southern border. (Image credit: Julia Nikhinson/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which state is under widespread flood alerts this week due to a potent pair of atmospheric rivers?
evidence: Millions of Californians are under flood alerts as storms threaten flash flooding in cities including San Diego, Sacramento, San Francisco, San Jose and Oakland. (Image credit: Carlos Barria/Reuters)

question_sentence: Which pop superstar is being associated with absurd conspiracy theories around the presidential election?
evidence: Right-wing media figures are targeting Taylor Swift with conspiracy theories ahead of the Super Bowl. Some are promoting the deranged notion that she is part of a sprawling psychological operations plot staged by the NFL and the Democratic Party to deliver the 2024 presidential election to President Joe Biden. (Image credit: Patrick Smith/Getty Images)

question_sentence: Russian Olympic competitor Kamila Valieva was recently banned from which sport for violating anti-doping rules?
evidence: The US Figure Skating team received a gold medal this week for its 2022 Beijing Winter Olympic performance after Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva was handed a four-year ban over a doping controversy. (Image credit: Justin Setterfield/Getty Images)

question_sentence: What did Elon Musk write on Twitter after losing a $56 billion case in the Court of Chancery?
choices: “Never incorporate your company in the state of Delaware.”

question_sentence: What is the name of the former Delaware State University student who is up against Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish at the 66th Grammy Awards?
What is the name of the newest cancer treatment developed by Incyte?
What is the name of the artist who created the La Côte Basque diorama that depicts Truman Capote dining with one of his “swans”?
What was the name of the University of Delaware student who was fatally shot outside his apartment at Studio Green Apartments near Newark in November 2012?
What was the final score of the game between the Delaware Blue Hens and the Towson Tigers in their CAA basketball match on January 27, 2024?
choices: 56-67 in favor of Delaware Blue Hens

question_sentence: What is the National Hurricane Center changing about the way it uses the forecast cone?
choices: The cone will no longer be used to show the likely path of the storm.
The cone will now include wind risk information.
The cone will now be used to show the potential for damage.

question_sentence: What was the highest one-day snowfall in Wilmington in January 2024?
What is the name of the Hamburgler’s car that McDonald’s is asking you to spot?
What is the name of the NFL team that Jason Kelce’s brother Travis plays for?
